title: Game is definitely rigged to make you spend money
text: Iâ€™ve been playing the game for a week now and at first it was fun. I won a few/ I lost a few. I made a bad gamble and lost a significant chunk of my change and thatâ€™s where it started. No matter what , I kept losing and couldnâ€™t catch back up. I lost some games to ridiculous shots that shouldnâ€™t have been in that level of playing. So I spent a few dollars to get some better cues and cash. Instead all I found was I ended up playing significantly higher level players and still losing!! To sum it up: the game is fun if you donâ€™t care about progressing much but is clearly designed to make you spend cash.

title: A game to pass the time
text:
This game is good. But will punish you if you invest to much time actually trying to improve your stats with back to back games. The developers have an incentive for consumers to keep the app downloaded through its algorithm. Meaning play a few games feel happy come back tomorrow. 

I had the apps downloaded for over 30 days made over 500,000 coins within that time. I won tournaments, became a champion in bronze, brass & silver leagues. I only played a few games here and there in passing. I never meant to play for stats or to even win just to have fun. 

However when decided to chase stats as mine were improving with each game. I would face A.I bots that were levels 110-150. In back to back games. Even though I was only level 20. That never happened when I was just casually playing the game every other day. I would face real players my level & from time to time become friends with those real people. 

The game also gives an advantage to players that were good sports & kind. I tested this theory quite often in fact. If you donâ€™t rush yourself & praise your opponent  for their effort. Then itâ€™s quite easy to get a Hail Mary win even though you shouldâ€™ve lost. Regardless this is one of the better games Iâ€™ve played. Just donâ€™t ever pay to play or pay to win. Donâ€™t become arrogant & attempt to win several back to back games. Eventually youâ€™ll face an opponent the algorithm has chosen to defeat you. Purposefully of course as losing keeps winners wanting to comeback for more.

title: stupid and scripted game.
text: I played this game for many years, and a year ago I decided to delete it because I could no longer stand this nonsense. I decided to download it again, and remembered why I decided to delete it. The game does not have any realistic physics, it is terribly scripted and unrealistic. For example, my cue ball is blocked by the opponentâ€™s balls and I decide to hit my ball from the wall, and then this circus begins, the ball flies in some incredible direction, by some miracle it touches the black ball, as a result, 2 enemy balls are pocketed and pocketed black ball. And believe me, this is only one of a million cases that happened during my gameplay of this game. And yes, I play this game very well, so there is no point in accusing me of being a bad player.

title: Predatory gambling microtransactions
text:
This app starts manipulating you the moment you open it. Once you manage to sign in using their broken sign-in process, before you can even start the game, it takes about 5 minutes to click through all of the various screens that come up, begging you to spend real-world money on the game. Again, this is before you can play the game for a single second. Once you do play, youâ€™re hit with more screens begging you to buy things. I have to close at least 10 â€œoffersâ€ for every game I play. 

This game used to be fun, but now itâ€™s predatory and cancerous. I recommend finding another one.
